question: What is your view on the concept of intercession?
answer:
QUESTION
As Sunnis when we make dua we ask what we want from Allah by adding 'Oh Allah, grant me such and such through the wasila of your Nabi(Pbuh)'. Is this what is meant by intercession, and is this permissable (ie not in any way shirk?) Please could you support your answer from the qur'an and/or ahadith. May Allah Reward You.
ANSWER


Share:
According to the Ahlus Sunnah Wal Jamaa`, Waseela, seeking Allah's help
through the medium of saintly persons and visiting their graves is
permissible. Both aspects are proven from Shari'ah.

Hadhrat Umar (Radhiallaahu Anhu) used to make Du'aa for rain through the
Waseela of Hadhrat Abbas (Radhiallaahu Anhu), the uncle of Rasulullah
(Sallallaahu Alayhi Wasallam). However, in view of the misconception in
Waseela, it is important to note that it is not permissible to make Du'aa to
anybody besides Allah.

and Allah Ta'ala Knows Best

Mufti Ebrahim Desai
FATWA DEPT.
